content.raw: I made changes in branch [sim_api_jackie](#!/osrf/haptix-comm/branch/sim_api_jackie) to reflect the new [sim_api PR](#!/osrf/haptix_api/pull-request/9/new-sim-api) and changes that came up during implementation. You can see the Gazebo-side implementation in `HaptixWorldPlugin` in branch [implement_sim_api](#!/osrf/handsim/branch/implement_sim_api) of handsim. Can you review and merge in?
content.html: I made changes in branch sim_api_jackie to reflect the new sim_api PR and changes that came up during implementation. You can see the Gazebo-side implementation in HaptixWorldPlugin in branch implement_sim_api of handsim. Can you review and merge in?

content.raw: Updated in df58087. @jacquelinekay , I modified the way the gravity is sent. We're not using the `int_value` anymore. We're using the `gravity` field in the `hxParam` message. You'll probably have to update `handsim`.
content.html: Updated in df58087. @jacquelinekay , I modified the way the gravity is sent. We're not using the int_value anymore. We're using the gravity field in the hxParam message. You'll probably have to update handsim.

content.raw: Replace `bool` with `int`, and update doxygen. Here and below.
content.html: Replace bool with int, and update doxygen. Here and below.

content.raw: This is an internal function compiled with the C++ compiler but not exposed to the clients writing C code. We're probably good with `bool` here.
content.html: This is an internal function compiled with the C++ compiler but not exposed to the clients writing C code. We're probably good with bool here.

content.raw:
Link to handsim branch with Gazebo-side implementation: [implement_sim_api](#!/osrf/handsim/branch/implement_sim_api#diff)

[`HaptixWorldPlugin`](#!/osrf/handsim/branch/implement_sim_api#chg-src/HaptixWorldPlugin.cc) creates a bunch of ignition transport subscribers that manipulate Gazebo models, links, joints, etc. in their callbacks

[`sim_api`](#!/osrf/handsim/branch/implement_sim_api#chg-test/integration/sim_api.cc) integration test shows several examples of the sim API calls.
content.html:
Link to handsim branch with Gazebo-side implementation: implement_sim_api

HaptixWorldPlugin creates a bunch of ignition transport subscribers that manipulate Gazebo models, links, joints, etc. in their callbacks

sim_api integration test shows several examples of the sim API calls.

content.html: @jacquelinekay , I removed the imu, quaternion, and time messages inside hxSensor in favor of hxVector3, hxQuaternion and hxTime. We'll have to update handsim.
